channel.title: Errors on Bloodstiller: Ethical Hacking & Active Directory Security Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Errors on Bloodstiller: Ethical Hacking & Active Directory Security Blog

item.title: SQLi Vulnerabilities: Lab 11: Visible error-based SQL injection
item.description:
Lab 11: Visible error-based SQL injection:

This lab contains a SQL injection vulnerability. The application uses a tracking cookie for analytics, and performs a SQL query containing the value of the submitted cookie. The results of the SQL query are not returned.

The database contains a different table called users, with columns called username and password. To solve the lab, find a way to leak the password for the administrator user, then log in to their account.

item.title: SQLi Vulnerabilities: Lab 10: Blind SQL injection with conditional errors
item.description:
Lab 10: Blind SQL injection with conditional errors:

This lab contains a blind SQL injection vulnerability. The application uses a tracking cookie for analytics, and performs a SQL query containing the value of the submitted cookie.

The results of the SQL query are not returned, and the application does not respond any differently based on whether the query returns any rows. If the SQL query causes an error, then the application returns a custom error message.
